Reviews.Title: “If you want to sleep at night just avoid...”
Reviews.Author: Babis P
Reviews.Content: Stayed in that hotel for 4 nights and every night sleeping was a challenge. The hotel is located just next to a night club which starts playing extremely loud music from midnight till 5 am. So if you don't sleep easily then just forget it. Apart from that the room was large and had all the amenities, but cleanliness was an issue. Found hair in both the shower and the bath when I first entered the room, and second day when the cleaner had been in, found out that apart from folding the sheets and fixing the bed everything else had been the left same. The food at the restaurant is quite poor as well for a 4 star hotel. The location is not the best but for someone like me who enjoys spending time walking it wasn't an issue. The staff was helpful and nice which is the only good thing I have to say for my stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Olimpic@”
Reviews.Author: Alain_P62
Reviews.Content: Wireless lan bad quality, Suite and mainly bath room not clean, Furniture damaged and cheap quality (Spanish plastic), Sound insulation inefficient, every rumour from the bathroom of the near-by room can be heard, Breakfast self service with little choice, Unidentified bad smell in the lobby abd the bar nearby, unfriendly staff

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Wrong Location”
Reviews.Author: GEORDIE M
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fantastic. It is very modern and clean. The rooms were great we found the beds comfortable although it wasnt a double but two singles pushed together. The only downside to the room was the glass door to the toilet, i have been with my partner for 10 years but i dont want to watch her take a dump! We found the staff very helpful, they gave us directions to metro stations and rang taxis for us. The big problem with the hotel is the location. Its only a 10/15 walk from the Olympic port but it seems like a world away. It is in a really rundown area. it seemed safe enough but was very dark and dingy. Because of the location we seemed to be either walking or riding metros for the whole time we were there. Although the hotel was great next time we go to Barcelona i think we will stay closer to the las ramblas area or port vell.

Reviews.Title: “Anniversary Treat”
Reviews.Author: Kevin E Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located above the oylmpic village and teh surrounding area is not pleasant, it is a fantastic hotel placed in a middle of a poor area. The rooms were ok, although we did request a double room and ended up with a twin room and the beds pushed together. The beds were quite firm and not that comfortable. The staff were very pleasant although struggled sometimes to understand us, being from a different country. The spa was fantastic, but use of the spa is not free and you need to be careful before booking as i assumed we had free access. This being said, it was worth the money paying for it as it was very relaxing.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely awful customer service”
Reviews.Author: Parvy
Reviews.Content: Checked in after a long flight and just wanted a hot shower. So get into the bathroom and the water is freezing. Ring downstairs and get through a supposedly night manager who was the rudest person on the planet an refused to help me. I went downstairs and asked for a resolution as I had 3 children me and there was no way they could shower in the freezing water. The rude night manager refused to help and just practically told me to go away!!! NOBODY STAY AT THIS HOTEL!!!

Reviews.Title: “Business trip to Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: OlsenFix
Reviews.Content: I stayed 4 nights at this hotel. Location is less than 10€ with taxi from Rambla. Close to Metro. Interesting room where you enter through the bathroom to the living room. Anyway, a nice quiet hotel. Clean. Good and cheap food in the hotel restaurant. I used the SPA and it was very good. They offered a SPA "tour". It took about 90 minutes, including all kinds of saunas and pools. Very nice and relaxing. 18€. The breakfast was very good. The area around the hotel is very special, lots of closed businesses and the first impression is this is an area you would not enter after dark, but I walked around there and no problems. According to the taxi drivers this is a very quiet area. Absolutely a hotel to recomend. Good free wireless offering.

Reviews.Title: “loved this!!”
Reviews.Author: lynn E
Reviews.Content: me and my boyfriend were there in september and we simply loved the hotel. the room was comfortable and had all the necessities and it was very clean. the staff were really friendly and helpful. the breakfast was quite good especially the spanish omlette!! the only downside is that it is A BIT far from the centre, but then again there is a metro station very close by (less than 5 minutes away) which takes you to la rambla and villa olimpica in a matter of few minutes. all in all we loved our stay. thank you all, i will be back!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: chillOldCoulsdon
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from this hotel with a group of 8 friends and although not in the best area it was ok for us as we like to walk and never felt any threat as there was no one about! A 10 minute stroll and we was at the beach. We thought the hotel was very nice, clean and quite helpful. They kept our luggage locked away for us after check-out as we had a late flight home, let us have use of a shower and all for free! Breakfast was more than adequate although a little slow with cultery, but not a major issue. The only issue for 2 of our group was the noise from the disco around the corner and other guests were heard compaining about this too!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible and thats Polite !!”
Reviews.Author: ispy71
Reviews.Content: Reception is a joke. The rooms look ok, but they are dirty and dusty. I would go into detail but really, take my word its bad. The Air con sounds like its generating enough cool air to freeze the artic, but its not the case, you could get cooler air from a volcano. The Area is shocking, and you would NEVER walk around alone and you are in the middle of no where and a horrible location at that. If you want sleep forget it. The disco is open until 5 am.. and its starts at 1am. Its so loud you will not sleep, i say this as ive just come back from the hotel, and cannot belive the noise from the club into the room with the windows closed. Boom Boom, Boom Boom !! The breakfast at best was shocking for 14 euros, so toast and jam it was. The staff offer as much help as a lame dog on a race track.. Good points, well leaving and knowing my boss booked here for a business trip and it wasnt my money and i would never go back. Really if you want a hotel, dont book here, unless you want the party life and then yes you will be happy with the club next door. If you want sleep, or in a couple who would like a nice trip away, then belive me, just dont dont go here, you will wish you had not.!!

Reviews.Title: “Modern, clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Bebe41155019
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 8 nights at this hotel. Reading other reviews, we were concerned about possible noise from a late night disco in the neighbourhood. We requested a quiet location and were given a clean, airy room, overlooking the street. In 8 nights we heard no music or loud noise whatsoever. The room was very clean and well maintained. The beds were comfortable and the linen was changed frequently. Lots of towels, soap, hot water etc. Free WiFi worked very well--in the room and at the pool. The front desk staff spoke English well and helped us cheerfully with directions and/or restaurant reservations. We had breakfast here every day--hot and cold food with lots of fruit, juice, coffee, etc. There was a nice pool and gazebo area in back of the hotel. The Metro (subway) is literally 5 minutes or less around the corner. It took less than 15 minutes to walk to Port Olimpic a wonderful beach, boardwalk and restaurant area. On the advice of the front desk we took a taxi home if returning after dark. We had a wonderful stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Close to beach, clean frienly staff, do not order the lunch!”
Reviews.Author: mike5352
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a strategy week with work colleagues. The rooms were very good, shower and bathroom was excellent, bed was large and comfortable and the sheets were clean. The room was a small suite, with tv and couches in one room, bed and bathroom in the other. The windows opened overlooking the courtyard where the swimming pool and sun loungers are. This hotel is close to a night club so sleeping wasn’t all that easy! The courtyard was lovely, sun loungers and comfortable areas of shade. WIFI worked fairly well outside as I was on my computer most of the day. The swimming pool was small but clean. We had hired the conference room for our strategy meetings, which was a good size, refreshments were good and projector etc all worked fine. The room has no windows which makes it a bit of a dungeon, but it was adequate. The breakfast was very good, good mix between hot food, pastries and bread and fresh fruit. Unfortunately I cannot say the same for the lunches which we (a group of roughly 20) were all of the opinion that they were pretty dreadful! We had pre-booked lunch for each day which we regretted. The hotel itself is in a good location, fairly short walk to the beach and some very good restaurants (we ate out every evening). The lifts were OK, but seemed to have a mind of their own sometimes (taking you to level 2 when you had pushed level 1!). The staff were friendly and helpful. All in all, a decent hotel, seeing as I didn’t pay I couldn’t speak for the value, although I would say that for it to be good value it would have to be fairly reasonable!

Reviews.Title: “Noisy hotel and Deceitful Publicity”
Reviews.Author: ljove1_r
Reviews.Content: Very noisy hotel because of uncivil customers outside Razmatazz disco… shouting, fighting, bikes … Attention: Deceitful publicity. They do NOT have triple rooms. According to the staff at reception: “Yes, you are right, you have a reservation for a triple room but our triple rooms are not for three persons (!!!); one of you must sleep in a folding bed”.

Reviews.Title: “Do not choose this hotel option--you will regret it!”
Reviews.Author: svlausanne
Reviews.Content: The pool is not actually made available to guests--it is only for kids 8 and up! Disco kept us up all night--no sleep. Spent a fortune on taxis to get into town for day visits and dinners. A true mistake -- after years of travel I am reminded of why I never take the flight and hotel option on the travel websites. There is no concierge service to advise on restaurants and activities. Rooms recently renovated but bed is hard.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel nice enough but run down area”
Reviews.Author: jab12Brighton
Reviews.Content: Travelled here with my daughter for 4 days, area not good for a 4* hotel nothing in the vicinity no bars or decent restaurants at all so be warned that you will need to go back into the city to eat or do as we did and stay out all day and into the evening. The hotel is very modern and nice and clean although expensive for dinner and drinks. Previous reviews stated friendly staff!! I beg to differ one particular member of Reception Staff was very rude when I wanted to purchase a cup of coffee and give him the 2 euro 40 cents cash insisting I put it on the room, I complained and asked to see Manager who was very rude and arrogant and basically shrugged his shoulders and offered no apology for his member of staffs rudeness. I work in customer services and have travelled quite a bit and was astonished by this attitude.Friday and Saturday nights there is a club nearby so prepare to put up with a lot of noise from club goers outside we were on the third floor but the noise did keep us awake. We never found the Metro Station but found the bus and used that instead. Loved Barcelona and would return however not to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “An extremely disappointing hotel in a very rundown area”
Reviews.Author: elvee_10
Reviews.Content: This hotel would be a very poor choice for visitors to the city of Barcelona.It may only be a few stops on the Metro to the city centre but it is too far away to return to the hotel to change for dinner and walk back to the Metro for an evening visit. The only other option is a taxi and this is expensive. Far better to choose a city centre hotel-- pop back for a lunch time siesta and you are still in the right location for dinner. The Villa Olimpic is supposed to be a "boutique" hotel but in reality it is cheaply decorated,cold and lack-lustre place with absolutely no creature comforts. The reception area is furnished with cheap white faux-leather hard chairs.There is nowhere to sit and relax. Room facilities are very intimate!! The toilet has a half frosted glass door so that anyone washing at the sink would have a full view of your toilet activities. Laminate floors throughout add to the ambience of the room Breakfast is an absolute fiasco, if you want to fight for a table and rush around like a headless chicken to collect food from the buffet then this is the place for you. The staff struggle to cope with the number of guests and the food frequently runs out,The coffee machines (2) produce only warm inedible liquid. Once you have found a table do not leave it to top- up your breakfast items----- before you know it someone else will have taken your table and you will have to resume your search!! This must truly be the "Fawlty Towers" of Barcelona and true to form there is at least one "Manuel" working here . This is supposed to be a 4 star rated hotel. My advice is to look elswhere

Reviews.Title: “Be prepared for taxi's.............”
Reviews.Author: jooby20100
Reviews.Content: Hotel was nice, pretty modern and well kept. Only problem was location, its in a ruin down part of the city and about 15-20 min walk to your nearest beach................

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: bunnybabePisa
Reviews.Content: We were immedately impressed with this hotel upon arrival. We knew that check-in was from 16 hrs but we were able to to do at 10 am in the morning as we arrived in Barcelona at 8am. The staff were friendly and efficient and spoke good English. Our room was very modern and spacious with a huge tub and shower , we were given fresh towels everyday.The room very clean and the housekeeping staff gave us extra toiletries.The pool although small was clean and the hotel provided towels for 2 euros each day.The spa was great and I experienced one of the best massages ever for a low cost.The hotel itself is just a short 15 minute walk from the centre of barcelona and just 10 minutes from the beach, the location of the hotel is not bad at all even though there are a few run down buildings and the sewers smell abit, but we felt very safe and never had any trouble form anyone. Overall I would recommend this hotel for those who like high tec hotels way from the hustle and bustle of the city centre.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic and good value place to stay”
Reviews.Author: ChrisDarwen
Reviews.Content: Just returned from The Villa OIimpic suites and spa hotel and i must say what a great hotel this was.Yes the hotel is a little off the beaten track but as many have said before me Bogatell the metro station is less than 3 minutes walk away and can get you to anywhere you want with the minimum of fuss.I actually enjoyed breakfast as the there was a great choice of cold and hot(just about warm)food.Use the coffee machine on the right though as it makes better coffee!I found the staff to be polite,smart and helpful.My wife and daughter used the pool and from what i could determine a few more loungers would be great.Nineteen just isnt enough even for a city break hotel.The poolside bar was a bit of a nightmare to get a drink from and on our last night i decided that twenty minutes waiting to place my order was shocking and i could not bother waiting any longer.On two other nights we did enjoy a great Caipirinha after a slightly shorter wait.There wasnt many impressive eating places around the hotel itself but a nice 15 minute stroll into the centre brings you within range of loads of places with a great range of cuisine.We had a fantastic time at this hotel and in Barcelona and although we stayed a week we could quite easily stayed another and still would have found new things to see and do.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic...go for it!”
Reviews.Author: RustyForest
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel mainly on price and research on Tripadvisor and other sites. Our main worry was about the apparent lack of english speaking staff and the noise from local night clubs...neither was a worry, (but i am sure an "Hola" at the start of a conversation helps!). There nearest station on the metro is Bogatell, about a 3 min walk away, our first impressions is that the area is not that nice, but again there was no worry at all and all seemed completely safe. The hotel check was quick and easy (at midnight) and we went for a quick drink by the poolside bar...again all clean, friendly etc. The rooms are fantastic, clean and spotless, well designed, big tv screens, fridge, walk in shower, glass sink etc. All great designed and modern. Our only negative was no tea making faciltities and our double bed was two singles pushed together. Our tarif did not include an evening meal or breakfast (we intended to go to the beach each morning), but the hotel was charging 12 euros each for a cold breakfast menu (cafe next door serves breakfast for 4 euros). A small glass of beer was 3 euros (garage over road sold nice Estrella for 1.50 euro for 500ml). The pool out side was nice and clean, perfect for a cooling dip, if however not the biggest pool out there! There is a indoor pool spa and jacuzzi but this is at extra cost All in all we were very impressed with the hotel, it was clean smart and modern, and we would def return and recommend this hotel to anyone, just if you have not got breakfast or evening meal be prepared to go to the many local bars, cafes, restaurants all nearby.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel base”
Reviews.Author: paul6348
Reviews.Content: We looked at the reviews for this hotel some good some bad ,We are glad we decided to come here we found the reception staff very helpful and polite .The location is a little way off the tourist trail but for 11 euro a 3 day pass is all you need ,The metro is fantastic for exploing this fantastic city, 2 metro stations close by,The beach is a 15 min walk, The hotel has a reasonably sized swimming pool at your door step to rest you tired legs. food is spanish so you cant moan we enjoyed it on a half board stay .Rooms are kept spotless ,Thanks for a great stay .

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel in a run-down area”
Reviews.Author: JourneyPilot
Reviews.Content: Recently returned from a 4-night stay at this hotel during a conference at the CCIB. Hotel is ~30 mins by taxi from the airport (approx. 40 euro cost). Check-in took longer than it should but I think the chap behind the desk was new. We stayed in room 2606 (top floor facing road). We had no issues with noise from nightclubs, however we did get a couple of early wake-up calls from a garbage truck. Room was nice and well equipped. Breakfast was adequate. We had a set-menu dinner on the first night; reasonable value but not the best food. Staff need to pay more attention to cleanliness as drink bottles were still on tables in the courtyard from the night before - no excuse for this. The location (Bogatell) is run down but has good metro links to the conference centre (10 mins) and central Barcelona (10 mins or 20 minute walk). I would definately recommend grabbing something to eat in the City. There are a few restaurants dotted around the hotel but we didn't try them. For the cost (400 euros for 4 nights) I believe this hotel was good value for money although I probably wouldn't stay there again, opting for something a bit more central. Enjoy your visit to Barcelona, it's well worth a visit!

Reviews.Title: “Modern/Trendy Hotel in reasonable location”
Reviews.Author: AnnaCassidy
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights on a half board basis. The Hotel is 5 mins walk from Bogadell Metro station & 15 mins from a lovely beach, the local area is a little run down. The hotel has a mainly young guest age (18/35) the rooms are modern with glassy bathrooms. Some have views of Segrada Familia. The outdoor pool is quite nice with loungers around them. On The Friday night there was very loud music from a bar/club nearby until 6am! Now the food-breakfast was acceptable although could be a bit better for a 4 star hotel. Dinner is a set menu with limited choice. (2 to 3 choices per course). This offered such things as rabbit with mustard & Duck gizzards! I had turkey skewer which was a pink, partially cold meat-I did not eat this. I would stay there again I would not eat dinner there.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here if you want any sleep”
Reviews.Author: Steveandmelanie
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for Easter weekend and have regretted it. I write as I cannot sleep for the noise of the disco which staff say goes on until 4am. The tv system has not worked all weekend. We stay in Barcelona regularly and this is by far our worst experience. If you want loud music and noisy drunks outside your window all night then book here. If not, avoid like the plague. We cannot wait until morning when we leave. So much for a peaceful relaxing weekend away.

Reviews.Title: “NICE ROOMS, LACK OF SECURITY, OR SERVICE. POOR MANAGEMENT.”
Reviews.Author: UKtravelteacher
Reviews.Content: We were a party of 24 people using 12 rooms. The rooms were clean and spacious, however, some had heating problems, and there was a lot of noise from the nightclub at the rear of the hotel that stayed open until 4.30am. The main issue was the lack of clear management. We had a couple of incidents. We booked on a half board basis and when gathering in the reception area prior to the evening meal, we were told by the receptionist that wine and water was included with the meal. My colleague and myself double checked this with the receptionist and she confirmed it. When I entered the then closed restaurant, I saw that on our tables were bottles of water and wine. As we had now been told by 2 members of staff of the inclusion of water and wine, I thought it must be correct. At the end of the meal I was given a bill for the water and wine. Then when we complained, the receptionist confirmed she had got it wrong, but we had to pay. I paid, and asked to see the manager the next day. When meeting with the manager he spent the whole time accusing us, or our agent of getting it wrong, however, I insisted that his staff had given us the wrong information. We were offered 5 free bottles of water per night, but only ever received 4. The second problem was more serious. I was robbed in the reception area on our final night (of a 3 night stay). This was carried out by a group of 3 people entering the hotel, and they working, using 1 as a decoy, then the other 2 snatched my bag. When reporting it to the receptionist, I was told it happened all the time. Then as I was in a group of 24 people, some of my colleagues came down to help, and they started to search the CCTV footage. At this point the security guard was seen. I will add here that the deputy manager was extremely helpful, however, yet again the manager was around but did not come over to help out or apologise for what happened in his hotel. Considering this is a regular occurence I question why the security guard is not placed out into the reception area to watch the door from people able to come in and plan their attack. One other point to note was the lack of desire to contact the police. I was told to walk to the police station, but they were very unkeen to telephone the police to report the theft, until we insisted. The hotel is fairly new, rooms are well designed, but if you do decide to stay there watch your possessions. One might question the role of the manager, as there was no sign of enhancing security for the guests and no apology for what happened in his hotel, but a complaint that he was giving away free water. I would not recommend anyone books this hotel. Unfortunately I cannot show photos of the hotel as my camera was one of the possessions stolen. Spa facilities are at an extra cost! The outdoor swimming pool was small but useable.

Reviews.Title: “Average tourist hotel”
Reviews.Author: Vatikaki
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for four nights and it was quite adequate and nicely located close to a bus stop and about 700m from a Metro. It was however in the part of town that used to be the industrial area so parts of it was not that great. The room was nice and quite modern with a nice bathroom (with a proper shower). We may stay there again in future as it was quite cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Bottom Line.. Thumbs Up!”
Reviews.Author: personna_84
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a five-night stay at the hotel and I must say each of us were fully satisfied with our choice. The hotel is new, clean and spotless. It is extremely well designed and the interior decors are fascinating. This was our first time in Barcelona and upon arriving to the hotel the lovely staff explained the essentials we needed to know about the city, metro system and nearby attractions. The rooms are just about the right size unless you are really in search for a spacious room. The bathroom area is large and it is equipped with a nice rain shower. Bathrooms are really lovely and the doors are shaded but they don't guarantee you fully privacy. Our booking came with a breakfast which included a variety of choices. The outside area , which is adjacent to the restaurant, can be used for dining. It is gorgeous with woody floors and a cabana-style setting. Since we were on our own, we inquired about many things and the staff did not save any efforts to guide us, and that was something we really appreciated. WiFi is also free. There are two metro stations close to the hotel, about 10 minutes of walking distance. The hotel is also situated close to the beach ~ about 20 minutes away. We did not use the pool but some of us used the spa and they loved it. they said it is modern and also very well taken care of. The neighborhood is not bad, another hotel is actually located just across the street, but you must also be aware of your surroundings as it is the case in almost any place you would visit.
